2:Taab,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Carbonada Criolla","description":"A hearty Argentine stew of beef, corn, squash, potatoes, and dried fruits — traditionally served in a hollowed-out pumpkin. A warming dish from the interior provinces that's perfect for winter.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/carbonada.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT30M","cookTime":"PT15M","totalTime":"PT31M","recipeYield":"6 servings","recipeCategory":"stew","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"carbonada recipe, argentine stew, carbonada criolla, beef stew argentina, pumpkin stew argentine","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"420 calories","proteinContent":"25g","carbohydrateContent":"48g","fatContent":"16g"},"recipeIngredient":["Main: 600g (1.3 lbs) beef chuck, cut into 2cm cubes","Main: 2 tbsp vegetable oil","Main: 1 large onion, diced","Main: 2 cloves garlic, minced","Main: 2 ripe tomatoes, diced","Main: 2 medium potatoes, peeled and cubed","Main: 1 sweet potato, peeled and cubed","Main: 300g butternut squash, cubed","Main: 2 ears corn, cut into rounds","Main: 1/2 cup dried peaches or apricots, halved","Main: 1 cup beef broth","Main: 1 tsp ground cumin","Main: 1 tsp smoked paprika","Main: 1 tsp dried oregano","Main: Salt and pepper to taste","Main: Fresh parsley for garnish"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Heat oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"Season beef cubes with salt, pepper, and cumin. Brown in batches, setting aside."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"In the same pot, sauté onion until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"Add tomatoes and cook until they break down, about 5 minutes."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"Return beef to the pot. Add paprika and oregano, stir to combine."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Pour in beef broth and bring to a simmer."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Add potatoes, sweet potato, and squash. Cover and simmer 30 minutes."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"Add corn rounds and dried fruit. Continue simmering uncovered for 30-40 minutes."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":9,"text":"The stew is ready when the beef is tender and the vegetables have partially broken down to thicken the broth."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":10,"text":"Season to taste with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh parsley."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":11,"text":"For presentation, serve inside a hollowed-out roasted pumpkin if desired."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],["$","div",null,{"className":"border-b bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm sticky top-0 z-40 print:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-5xl mx-auto px-4 py-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between","children":["$","$L3",null,{"href":"/food/recipes","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-arrow-left w-4 h-4","aria-hidden":"true","children":["$L4","$L5","$undefined"]}],"All Recipes"],"data-slot":"button","data-variant":"ghost","data-size":"sm","className":"inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap text-sm font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:hover:bg-accent/50 h-8 rounded-md px-3 has-[>svg]:px-2.5 gap-2","ref":null}]}]}]}],"$L6","$L7","$L8"]}],null,"$L9"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}

inside to serve."}]]}],["$","li","3",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 1d:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Carbonada is a criollo dish that dates back to colonial Argentina, blending Indigenous and Spanish cooking traditions. The combination of savory meat with sweet fruits (peaches, dried apricots) reflects the Moorish influence that came through Spain. It's traditionally served in a hollowed-out zapallo (pumpkin), which acts as both cooking vessel and serving bowl. The pumpkin flesh is scooped out and eaten with the stew."}]}]]}]
1e:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Refrigerate for up to 3 days. The flavor improves the next day. Freeze for up to 2 months."}]}]]}]
